thread.title: Pope may have secretly met with clerk who refused to give gay marriage licenses
thread.title_full: Pope may have secretly met with clerk who refused to give gay marriage licenses | News24

author: news24.com
title: Pope may have secretly met with clerk who refused to give gay marriage licenses
text:
Kentucky - Pope Francis secretly met a Kentucky county clerk who was jailed for refusing to issue marriage licenses to gay couples and gave her words of encouragement, her attorney told CBS News.
Mat Staver, attorney and founder of the Liberty Counsel, told CBS News the pope met Rowan County Clerk Kim Davis and her husband at the Vatican Embassy in Washington, last Thursday, during his visit to the United States.
The Vatican's chief spokesperson, Father Federico Lombardi, said he would neither confirm nor deny the report.
Staver told CBS his team did not want to disclose the meeting until now to avoid interfering with the pope's broader message during his visit to the United States.
